intro: Hieracium forticulum, commonly known as the hardy hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and ragworts, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer, followed by seed production. Hieracium forticulum is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in various environmental conditions.
